{{also|Appendix:Variations of "da"}} ==Translingual== {{character info/new|„ç≤}} {{wikipedia|dab=DA}} ===Symbol=== {{mul-symbol}} # {{lb|mul|metrology}} Symbol for the [[prefix]] [[deca-]], indicating multiplication by 10 ---- ==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|UK|Article}} {{IPA|en|/d…ô/|/d√¶/}} * {{a|UK|Noun}} {{IPA|en|/d…ëÀê/}} ===Etymology 1=== From child language; compare {{m|en|dad}} and {{m|en|dada}}. ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|Ireland|Scotland|Northern England}} [[father|Father]]. #* {{quote-book|en|year=2008|author={{w|James Kelman}}|title=Kieron Smith, Boy|publisher=Penguin 2009|page=55}} #*: {{ux|en|Oh where is yer '''da''' son? The man said it to me and was grumpy. Is yer '''da''' here?}} =====Synonyms===== * {{l|en|pa}}, {{l|en|Pa}} * {{l|en|daddy}} ===Etymology 2=== Borrowing from {{bor|en|ru|–¥–∞||yes}}. ====Noun==== {{en-noun|-}} # {{lb|en|slang|Russianism}} [[yes|Yes]]; an affirmative response. ====Interjection==== {{en-interjection}} # {{lb|en|slang|Russianism}} [[yes|Yes]]. =====Antonyms===== * {{l|en|nyet}} ===Etymology 3=== Representing pronunciation of {{m|en|the}} in informal speech. ====Article==== {{head|en|article}} # {{lb|en|in the US, especially used in|_|Chicago|and|New York}} {{pronunciation spelling of|en|the}} #: {{ux|en|'''Da''' New York Times}} #: {{ux|en|'''''Da''' Bears''}} ====Quotations==== * {{seeCites|en}} ===Etymology 4=== Imitative. ====Interjection==== {{en-interj}} # {{non-gloss definition|A meaningless syllable used when singing a tune or indicating a rhythm.}} #: ''You know that tune that goes "'''da da da''' di-dum di-dum"?'' ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=ad|'ad|-ad|A.D.|AD|ad|ad-|ad.}} [[Category:English two-letter words]] [[Category:en:Hair]] ---- ==Aiwoo== ===Verb=== {{head|nfl|verb}} # to [[swim]], [[drift]], [[float]] ===References=== * {{R:ABVD|lang=√Ñiwoo|id=501|cite={{cite-journal|author=Ross, M. & N√¶ss, √Ö.|date=2007|title=An Oceanic origin for √Ñiwoo, the language of the Reef Islands?|work=Oceanic Linguistics|volume=46|issue=2}}.}} ---- ==Bambara== ===Etymology 1=== ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|bm|d√°}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|bm|[d√°√†]}} ====Noun==== {{head|bm|noun}} # {{lb|bm|anatomy}} [[mouth]], [[orifice]] # [[door]], [[doorway]] ===Etymology 2=== ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|bm|d√†}} ====Pronunciation==== ====Noun==== {{head|bm|noun}} # plant that is source of [[kenaf]] fiber (''[[Hibiscus cannabinus]]'') #: {{syn|bm|daba}} # [[roselle]] {''Hibiscus sabdariffa'') #: {{syn|bm|dabilen}} ===References=== * 2007. [[Category:bm:Mallow subfamily plants]] ---- ==Basque== ===Verb=== {{head|eu|verb form}} # {{inflection of|eu|izan||3|singular|pres|indc}}; [[is]], he is, she is, it is # third-person present auxiliary for intransitive (''nor'') verbs ---- ==Breton== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|br|cel-pro|*tu||to}}. ====Preposition==== {{head|br|preposition|requires soft mutation}} # {{l|en|to}} #: {{ux|br|An den a zo aet '''da''' Vreizh.|inline=1|t=The man went '''to''' Brittany.}} =====Inflection===== {{br-prep-2|d|type=a}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|br|cel-pro|*tu||your, thy}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|br|pronoun|requires soft mutation}} # {{l|en|your|g=s}} ---- ==Cebuano== ===Etymology 1=== Initial clipping of {{m|ceb|ada}}. ====Pronunciation 1==== * {{a|General Cebuano}} {{IPA|ceb|/d√¶/}} * {{rhymes|ceb|d√¶}} ====Interjection==== {{head|ceb|interjection}} # It's [[unimportant]]. ===Etymology 2=== Undetermined ====Pronunciation 2==== * {{a|General Cebuano}} {{IPA|ceb|/Ààd…ë/}} * {{rhymes|ceb|d…ë}} ====Interjection==== {{head|ceb|interjection}} # {{lb|ceb|idiom}} [[serves you right]] # {{lb|ceb|idiom}} [[good for you]] =====Synonyms===== * {{l|ceb|mayra}}, {{l|ceb|mirisi}} ---- ==Cimbrian== ===Etymology=== Cognate with {{cog|de|da}}; see there for more. ===Adverb=== {{head|cim|adverb}} # {{lb|cim|7}} [[there]] #: {{ux|cim|b√®ar khimmet bor hia un b√®ar gh√©et bor '''da'''|who comes here, and who goes '''there'''}} ===References=== * {{R:Martalar1974}} ---- ==Dalmatian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dlm|la|-}} {{m|la|de}} {{m|la|ab}}. Compare {{cog|it|da}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|dlm|preposition}} # [[from]] # [[of]] ---- ==Danish== ===Adverb=== {{da-adv}} # [[surely]] # [[then]] ===Conjunction=== {{head|da|conjunction}} # [[when]] (referring to finished events) #: {{ux|da|'''Da''' jeg var ung, fandtes der ikke computere.|t=When I was young, there were no computers.}} # [[as]], at the same time as #: {{ux|da|'''Da''' jeg kom, gik hun.|t=As I arrived, she left.}} # [[because]] #: '''Da''' hun er mindre√•rig kan hun ikke id√∏mmes f√¶ngsel. #:: '''As''' she is underage, she cannot be sentenced to prison. ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|because}} {{l|da|fordi}} ====See also==== * {{l|da|n√•r}} ---- ==Dena'ina== ===Conjunction=== {{head|tfn|conjunction}} # [[when]] # [[if]] ===Adverb=== {{head|tfn|adverb}} # [[there]] ---- ==Esperanto== ===Etymology=== From {{der|eo|fr|de}}, {{der|eo|it|di}}, altered to differenciate {{m|eo|de}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|eo|Eo-da.ogg|Audio}} * {{IPA|eo|/da/}} ===Preposition=== {{eo-prep}} # Of (''used instead of [[de]] with quantities, to emphasize the quantity rather than the thing quantified, or to indicate the unity of a shape and its material, a container and its contents, or a group and its members'')Sergio Pokrovskij (2007) [http://lingvakritiko.com/2007/02/05/la-artikolo/#Da 'La artikolo'], in ''Lingva Kritiko: Studoj kaj notoj pri la Internacia Lingvo''[http://reta-vortaro.de/revo/art/da.html 'Da'] ''Reta vortaro'' #: {{quote|eo|glaso '''da''' vino|inline=1|t=a glass ''of'' wine}} #: {{ux|eo|kilogramo '''da''' viando|inline=1|t=a kilogram ''of'' meat}} #: {{ux|eo|grupo '''da''' homoj|inline=1|t=a group ''of'' people}} #: {{ux|eo|kvar metroj '''da''' ƒâi tiu ≈ùtofo kostas na≈≠ frankojn|inline=1|t=four meters ''of'' this cloth costs nine francs}} #: {{quote|eo|Li ligis la tri florojn en bukedon, kaj prezentis al ≈ùi tiun bukedon '''da''' floroj|t=He tied the three flowers into a bouquet, and presented her with this bouquet ''of'' flowers}} #: {{ux|eo|Damasko [...] estos amaso '''da''' ruinaƒµoj|inline=1|t=Damascus will be a mass ''of'' ruins}} #: {{ux|eo|tuto '''da''' kondiƒâoj kaj cirkonstancoj, en kiuj iu troviƒùas|inline=1|t=all ''of'' the conditions and circumstances in which we find ourselves}} #: {{ux|eo|sistemo '''da''' sonoj por la esprimado de pensoj|inline=1|t=a system ''of'' sounds for the expression of thought}} ====Usage notes==== Unlike most prepositions, ''da'' cannot occur after a verb. It necessarily links two nouns. The article ''la'' does not occur after the preposition ''da'', and this is often mistakenly understood to mean that the quantity introduced by ''da'' must be indefinite. However, there is no such restriction, any more than there is with possessive pronouns such as ''mia'' 'my', which also do not allow the article. Because of the unity of the two nouns linked by ''da'', only the phrase can be modified by the article, so it must precede the first noun. See the fourth and fifth examples above. Some Esperanto dictionaries substitute ''listo de'' and ''tuto de'' for ''listo da'' and ''tuto da''. This is an error, an influence of Western languages which do not have an equivalent to ''da''. ===== More examples of use ===== Compare these: * {{ux|eo|listo '''da''' kandidatoj|inline=1|t=a list ''of'' candidates (list of names)}} * {{ux|eo|listo '''da''' kondiƒâoj '''de''' la kandidatoj|inline=1|t=a list of conditions from the candidates}} - * {{ux|eo|skatolo '''da''' ƒâokolado|inline=1|t=a box ''of'' chocolates}} (a boxful of chocolate) * {{ux|eo|skatolo '''de''' ƒâokolado|inline=1|t=a chocolates box}} (the box itself, made for chocolates, but now perhaps used to store paper clips) * {{ux|eo|skatolo '''el''' ƒâokolado|inline=1|t=a box ''made of'' chocolate}} - * {{ux|eo|la spektaklo da≈≠ris duonon '''da''' horo|inline=1|t=the show lasted half an hour}} * {{ux|eo|tri estas duono de ses|inline=1|t=three is half of six}} - * {{ux|eo|ho, se mia kapo havus sufiƒâe '''da''' akvo kaj miaj okuloj estus fonto '''da''' larmoj!|inline=1|t=oh, if my head had enough water, and my eyes were a spring ''of'' tears!}} * {{ux|eo|fonto de akvo|inline=1|t=a spring of water}}which indicates the kind of spring rather than the quantity of tears. Even dry eyes could be said to be ''fonto de larmoj'' 'a source of tears',, ''fonto da larmoj'' indicates that they are tear-filled eyes. ===References=== {{Universala Vortaro}} {{eo BRO|1}} ---- ==Ewe== ===Noun=== {{head|ee|noun}} # [[bow]] # [[mother]] # [[snake]] ---- ==Fala== ===Etymology=== From {{der|fax|roa-opt|da}}, from {{m|roa-opt|de}} + {{m|roa-opt|a}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|fax|preposition|g=f|plural|das|masculine|do|masculine plural|dos}} # {{non-gloss definition|contraction of {{l|fax|de|'''de'''|gloss=of}} + {{l|fax|a|'''a'''|gloss=the}}}} #* {{quote-book|fax|year=2000|author=Domingo Frades Gaspar|title=Vamus a falal: Notas p√¢ co√±ocel y platical en nosa fala|publisher=Editora regional da Extremadura|section=Theme I, Chapter 1: Lengua Espa√±ola|passage=A grandeda '''da''' lengua espa√±ola √© indiscotibli, i sei estudio, utilizaci√≥n defensa debin sel algo consostancial a nos, {{...}}|translation=The greatness '''of the''' Spanish language is unquestionable, and its study, use and defense must be something consubstantial to us, {{...}}}} ---- ==Galician== ===Etymology=== From contraction of preposition {{m|gl|de||of, from}} + feminine definite article {{m|gl|a||the}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gl|/dÃ™…ê/}} ===Contraction=== {{head|gl|contraction|g=f|masculine|do|masculine plural|dos|feminine plural|das}} # [[of]] [[the]]; [[from]] the ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From a merger of three interrelated adverbs: 1.) {{inh|de|gmh|dƒÅ}}, {{m|gmh|dƒÅr|t=there, at that place}}, from {{inh|de|goh|thƒÅr}}, {{m|goh|dƒÅr}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*√æar}}. 2.) {{inh|de|gmh|dar}}, {{m|gmh|dare|t=thither, to that place}}, from {{inh|de|goh|thara}}, {{m|goh|dara}}, from an extended form of the former. 3.) {{inh|de|gmh|d≈ç}}, {{m|gmh|duo|t=then, at that time}}, from {{cog|goh|th≈ç}}, {{m|goh|d≈ç}}, {{m|goh|duo}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*√æ≈ç}}. The three forms were already sometimes intermingled in Old and Middle High German. The eventual loss of the distinction in modern German was reinforced by phonetic mergers in various dialects. Today, the senses of adverbs 1 and 3 are covered by {{m|de||da}}, while adverb 2 has been chiefly replaced with {{m|de|hin}}, {{m|de|dahin}}. The form {{m|de||dar-}} remains as a variant of {{m|de|da-}} before vowels and in some compound verbs (like {{m|de|darlegen}}, {{m|de|darbringen}}). Adverb 1 and 2 are cognate with {{cog|nl|daar}}, {{cog|en|there}}, {{cog|sv|d√§r}}. Adverb 3 is cognate with {{cog|nl|toen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/daÀê/|[d√§Àê]}} * {{audio|de|De-at-da.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-da.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aÀê}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # {{lb|de|local}} [[there]]; [[here]] #* '''1918''', [[w:de:Elisabeth von Heyking|Elisabeth von Heyking]], ''[[s:de:Aus dem Lande der Ostseeritter|Aus dem Lande der Ostseeritter]]'', in ''Zwei Erz√§hlungen'', Phillipp Reclam jun., page 78: #*: {{ux|de|Am liebsten entfloh sie dem allem in den gro√üen Garten. '''Da''' verbrachte sie ihre sch√∂nsten Stunden.|t=She liked best to escape from all of that into the big garden. There she spent her most pleasant hours.}} #: ''Wir fahren nach Hamburg. Meine Frau hat eine Freundin, die '''da''' wohnt.'' #:: We‚Äôre going to Hamburg. My wife has a friend who lives '''there.''' #: ''Die G√§ste sind noch nicht '''da.''''' #:: The guests aren‚Äôt '''here''' yet. # {{lb|de|temporal}} [[then]]; [[so]]; at that [[moment]] #: ''Ich war gerade eingeschlafen, und '''da''' kam ein Anruf.'' #:: I had just fallen asleep, and '''that‚Äôs when''' someone called. #: ''Er hat immer weiter auf mich eingeschrien. '''Da''' bin ich einfach gegangen.'' #:: He just kept on shouting at me. '''So''' I just left. # {{lb|de|colloquial}} {{non-gloss definition|replaces any [[pronominal adverb]] when the context is clear}} #: ''Ich wollte eigentlich Linsensuppe machen, aber '''da''''' (= {{l|de|daf√ºr}}, {{l|de|dazu}}) ''hatte ich das Rezept nicht.'' #:: I was actually going to make lentil soup, but I didn‚Äôt have the recipe '''for it.''' #: ''Wir haben jetzt ein Angebot gekriegt, aber '''da''''' (= {{l|de|dar√ºber}}) ''m√ºssen wir noch diskutieren.'' #:: We‚Äôve now received an offer, but we‚Äôll still need to have discussion '''about that.''' ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|there}} {{l|de|dort}} * {{sense|then}} {{l|de|also}}; {{l|de|dann}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|ebenda}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|allda}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # [[since]]; [[as]]; [[because]]; [[given]] that #* '''1931''', [[w:Arthur Schnitzler|Arthur Schnitzler]], ''[[s:de:Flucht in die Finsternis|Flucht in die Finsternis]]'', [[w:S. and {{der|nn|non|√æ√° er|t=when|pos=conjunction}}, and {{der|nn|de|da|t=because|pos=conjunction}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nn|/d…ëÀê/}} {{nn-pronu-note}} ===Adverb=== {{head|nn|adverb}} # {{l|en|then}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|nn|datid}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|nn|conjunction}} # {{l|en|when}} # {{l|en|because}} ===References=== * {{R:The Nynorsk Dictionary}} ---- ==Nyunga== ===Noun=== {{head|nys|noun}} # [[mouth]] ===References=== * {{RQ:BindonChadwick2011}} {{LDL|nys}} ---- ==Ojibwe== ===Particle=== {{head|oj|particle}} # [[please]], [[come on]] {{qualifier|clarification marker}} #: da {{l|oj|naa}}! ‚Äî ''[[damn it]]!'' ====Related terms==== * {{l|oj|daga}} ---- ==Old English== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|ang|d ∞eh‚ÇÅ(y)}} From {{inh|ang|gem-pro|*dajj«≠}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/d…ëÀê/}} ===Noun=== {{ang-noun|head=dƒÅ|f}} # [[doe]], female [[fallow deer]] ====Declension==== {{ang-decl-noun|[[da|dƒÅ]]|[[dan|dƒÅn]]|[[dan|dƒÅn]]|[[dan|dƒÅn]]|[[dan|dƒÅn]]|[[dana|dƒÅna]]|[[dan|dƒÅn]]|[[daum|dƒÅum]]}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|enm|da}}, {{l|enm|do}}, {{l|enm|doo}} ** {{desc|sco|da}}, {{l|sco|dae}} ** {{desc|en|doe}} [[Category:ang:Cervids]] [[Category:ang:Mammals]] ---- ==Polish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{pl-IPA}} ===Verb=== {{head|pl|verb form}} # {{inflection of|pl|daƒá||3|s|futr|indc}} ---- ==Portuguese== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|pt|roa-opt|da}}, from {{m|roa-opt|de||of}} + {{m|roa-opt|a||feminine definite article}}. ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|pt|d'a}} {{qualifier|dated}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{a|Brazil}} {{IPA|pt|/da/}} * {{a|PT}} {{IPA|pt|/d…ê/}} * {{hyphenation|pt|da}} ====Preposition==== {{head|pt|preposition|g=f-s|plural|das|masculine|do|masculine plural|dos}} # {{senseid|pt|de a}} {{contraction of|pt|[[de]] [[a]]||pertaining or relating to the}} {{l|en|of|Of}} the; {{l|en|from}} the (feminine singular) #* {{RQ:mul:Rowling Harry Potter|pt-BR|6|page=104|text=Ela estava sentada no parapeito '''da''' janela do quarto [...]|t=She was sitting on the parapet '''of the''' window of the room [...]}} =====Quotations===== {{seeCites|pt|do}} ====See also==== * {{l|pt|do}} {{qualifier|masculine form}} * {{l|pt|das}} {{qualifier|plural form}} * {{l|pt|dos}} {{qualifier|masculine plural form}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Verb==== {{head|pt|verb form}} # {{senseid|pt|obsolete spelling of d√°}} {{obsolete spelling of|pt|d√°}} #* {{pt-cite-peregrina√ßam}} #*: {{...}}, com que cada d√≠a nos '''da''' noticia de outras t√£o nouas que parece que a excedem, {{...}} #*:: {{...}}, with which he '''gives''' us each day news of other [marvels] so new that they seem to exceed it, {{...}} {{catlangname|pt|terms with multiple etymologies}} ---- ==Romanian== ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|ro|Ru-–¥–∞.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|ro|/da/}} * {{rhymes|ro|a}} ===Etymology 1=== From a {{der|ro|sla}} language (e.g. Bulgarian, Serbo-Croatian, Russian; or rather a loan from a Common Slavic before the emergence of distinct modern languages), from {{der|ro|sla-pro|*da}}. Cf. also the word's presence in other non-Slavic tongues such as Albanian {{m|sq|da}}, Greek {{m|el|Œ¥Œ¨}}, although very rarely used. * Another less likely (and controversial) theory argues that, being such a common and basic word, a borrowing seems unusual (even considering [[slang]]) and it perhaps derived originally from the Latin {{m|la|ita}}, one of several ways to say "thus", "so" or "yes"; it further may have been influenced by the ''da'', also meaning "yes", in the surrounding Slavic languages before reaching its present state (see [[Sprachbund]]).[https://web.archive.org/web/20091104193350/http://www.romaniaminor.net/ianua/Ianua08/05.pdf A Latin etymology for Romanian da = yes], by Keith Andrew Massey, 2008-06-30 See also ''[[dacƒÉ]]'', which according to this theory derives from {{m|la||ita quod}}. In some regions, {{m|ro|ta}} is used repeatedly to indicate impatience with someone talking too much or aimlessly, although this is more likely onomatopoetic in origin. Nonetheless, Romanian etymological dictionaries derive {{m|ro||da}} from a Slavic language, which is almost certainly the primary source. [http://dexonline.ro/definitie/da Romanian Explanatory Dictionary]. ====Interjection==== {{head|ro|interjection}} # [[yes]] =====Antonyms===== * {{l|ro|nu}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|ro|la|dare}}, present active infinitive of {{m|la|d≈ç}}, ultimately from {{inh|ro|itc-pro|*did≈ç}}, from {{inh|ro|ine-pro|*d√©deh‚ÇÉti}}, from the root {{m|ine-pro|*deh‚ÇÉ-||give}}. Compare {{cog|rup|dau|dau, dari}}, {{cog|it|dare}}, {{cog|es|dar}}. ====Verb==== {{ro-verb|dƒÉ|dat}} # to [[give]] =====Conjugation===== {{ro-conj-2 |type=1 |ger=d√¢nd |past=dat |1s=dau |2s=dai |3s=dƒÉ |1p=dƒÉm |2p=da»õi |3p=dau |3sub=dea |perf=dƒÉdu |3perf=dƒÉdu |imp=dƒÉde |3imp=dƒÉdea |2imp=dƒÉ }} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|ro|dare}} ===References=== ---- ==Romansch== ===Alternative forms=== * {{qualifier|before vowels}} {{l|rm|dad}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|rm|la|dƒì}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|rm|preposition}} # [[of]], [[from]] # [[about]] ---- ==Scottish Gaelic== ===Prepositional pronoun=== {{head|gd|prepositional pronoun}} # {{alternative form of|gd|dha}} ---- ==Serbo-Croatian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|sh|sla-pro|*da}}, probably old imperative of the word {{m|sh|d»Åti}}, itself from {{der|sh|ine-pro|*deh‚ÇÉ-||to give}}. ===Conjunction=== {{sh-conjunction}} # [[that]] #: {{ux|sh|Rekao je '''da''' ƒáe doƒái.|t=He said that he would come.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|Rekao sam ti '''da''' nemam pojma o ƒçemu priƒça≈°!|t=I told you that I have no idea what you are talking about!|inline=1}} # [[to]], [[so]], [[so that]], [[in order to]] #: {{ux|sh|Do≈°ao je '''da''' mi sve ispriƒça.|t=He came to tell me everything.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|Do≈°ao je ovdje '''da''' naƒëe posao.|t=He came here to find work.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' bi se i mi mogli natjecati, moramo vje≈æbati.|t=To be able to compete, we have to practice.|inline=1}} # [[to]] (when the subjects of both clauses are not the same) #: {{ux|sh|On hoƒáe '''da''' mu poka≈æete put do stanice.|t=He wants you to show him the way to the station.}} # {{qualifier|Serbian}} [[to]] (when the subjects of both clauses are the same; for western Serbo-Croatian use infinitive instead of {{m|sh|da}} + present tense) # {{lb|sh|subjunctive only|often followed by {{m|sh|i}}}} [[if]], [[even if]] (= {{m|sh|kad}}) #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' sam na va≈°em m(j)estu, ne bih se puno zamarao takvim detaljima.|t=If I were you, I wouldn't bother too much with such details.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' si vi≈°e radio, zaradio bi vi≈°e novca.|t=Had you worked harder, you would have made more money.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da i''' znam ne bih ti rekao!|Even if I knew I wouldn't tell you!|inline=1}} # {{lb|sh|usually preceded by {{m|sh|k»Åo}}}} [[as if]], [[as though]], [[like]] #: {{ux|sh|S(j)eƒáam se, '''kao da''' je bilo juƒçe(r).|t=I remember, as if it were yesterday.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Kao da''' ne zna≈° o ƒçemu priƒçam!|t=As if you don't know what I'm talking about!|inline=1}} # {{lb|sh|usually preceded by {{l|sh|a}}}} [[without]] (after negative verbs) #: {{ux|sh|Odlazi, '''a da''' nije rekao ni zbogom.|t=He's leaving without even saying goodbye.|inline=1}} # {{lb|sh|archaic|literary|religious}} [[lest]] #: {{ux|sh|Onaj koji se bori protiv zla treba paziti '''da''' time i sam ne postane zao.|t=He who fights evil need care lest he thereby become evil himself.|inline=1}} =====Usage notes===== As a conjunction with the sense of "if", ''da'', just like synonymous {{m|sh|kad}}, is only used in [[subjunctive mood]], to express what one wishes were the case or hypothetical situations contrary to reality in general. For all other uses, {{m|sh|ako}} is used instead. ===Particle=== {{sh-particle}} # [[yes]] #: {{ux|sh|Je li tako? Da!|inline=1|t=Is that so? Yes!}} # {{lb|sh|Serbian}} {{non-gloss definition|used when starting a question}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' li ste ≈æedni?|inline=1|t=Are you thirsty?}} #: {{ux|sh|Reci mi '''da''' li je to istina?|inline=1|t=Tell me if that is true?}} # {{non-gloss definition|Used in various phrases, expressing wishes, commands etc.}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' se nisi usudio!|inline=1|t=Don't you dare!}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' Bog dao!|inline=1|t=God willing!|lit=If God gives (it).}} #: {{ux|sh|'''Da''' poƒçnemo!|inline=1|t=Let's begin!}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|when starting a question}} {{l|sh|je li}} {{qualifier|Croatian|Serbian}} ---- ==Skolt Sami== ===Etymology=== Presumably loaned from a Russian language (compare with {{cog|ru|–¥–∞}}) or from {{der|sms|sla-pro|*da}}. ===Conjunction=== {{head|sms|conjunction}} # [[and]] ====Further reading==== * {{R:√Ålgu|64247}} ---- ==Tolai== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|ksd|dat}} {{qualifier|when not preceding a verb}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|ksd|pronoun}} # ''First-person inclusive plural pronoun'': you (many) and I, you (many) and me ====Declension==== {{ksd-decl-personal pronouns}} ---- ==Turkish== ===Adverb=== {{head|tr|adverb}} # [[as well]], [[too]], [[also]] #: {{ux|tr|o da sorunun yanƒ±tƒ±nƒ± biliyor|inline=1|t=he/she/it also knows the answer of the question}} #: {{ux|tr|Oƒüuzhan da bizimle geliyor|inline=1|t=Oƒüuzhan is coming with us as well}} #: {{ux|tr|Yaƒüƒ±z da dondurma yemeyi sever|inline=1|t=Yaƒüƒ±z likes eating ice cream, too.}} ====Usage notes==== * It's used when the previous word's last vowel is "a", "ƒ±", "o" or "u". Otherwise (if the word's last vowel is "e", "i", "√∂" or "√º"); it becomes "[[de]]" ====Synonyms==== * {{l|tr|de}} ---- ==Uzbek== ===Particle=== {{head|uz|particle|Cyrillic spelling|–¥–∞}} # Locative case marker. It is used to show the time or the place of an action. Equates to "[[in]]", or "[[at]]" in English. #* {{ux|uz|Samarqand'''da''' yashayman.|t=I live '''in''' Samarqand.}} #* {{ux|uz|Soat uch'''da''' boraman.|t=I go at 3 o'clock.}} ====Usage notes==== * When used after interrogative pronouns '''da''' can take on different meanings. Pronouns such as {{m|uz|kim||who}}, {{m|uz|nima||what}}, {{m|uz|qayer||where}}, {{m|uz|necha||how many, how much}} become {{m|uz|kimda||to whom}}, {{m|uz|nimada||with what, by using what}}, {{m|uz|qayerda||from where}}, {{m|uz|nechada||what time}}. ---- ==Vanimo== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|vam|/da/}} ===Noun=== {{head|vam|noun}} # [[pig]] ===References=== * ''Dialogue on Dialect Standardization'', edited by Carrie Dyck, Tania Granadillo, Keren Rice [[Category:vam:Pigs]] ---- ==Veps== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|vep|ru|–¥–∞}}. ===Conjunction=== {{head|vep|conjunction}} # [[and]] ===References=== * {{R:vep:UVVV|–¥–∞|–∏}} ---- ==Vietnamese== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|vi|mkh-vie-pro|*-taÀê}};
